content: I think I understand the difference between 401(k) and IRA a bit better now. I'll definitely check with my HR department to see if my company offers a 401(k) plan and if they provide matching contributions. I'm also considering consulting a financial advisor to help me make a personalized decision. By the way, since I attended my high school reunion recently, which was 10 years since I graduated, I've been thinking about my life goals and priorities, and I'm wondering if you can help me with setting up a budget and tracking my expenses.
